search_results.title: The Governors, Part One: Democrats Start as Favorites in 2025 New Jersey and Virginia Races
search_results.text:
Skip links

- [Skip to primary navigation](https://centerforpolitics.org/crystalball/the-governors-part-one-democrats-start-as-favorites-in-2025-new-jersey-and-virginia/#primary-nav)
- [Skip to content](https://centerforpolitics.org/crystalball/the-governors-part-one-democrats-start-as-favorites-in-2025-new-jersey-and-virginia/#lqd-site-content)

### KEY POINTS FROM THIS ARTICLE

— While 2026 will feature three dozen gubernatorial contests, two states, New Jersey and Virginia, will elect governors in open-seat races this year.

— We are starting out both 2025 contests, which are in states that backed Kamala Harris by nearly 6 points apiece, as Leans Democratic.

— In New Jersey, Rep. Mikie Sherrill (D, NJ-11) is a tenuous favorite for the Democratic nomination amidst a crowded field, while 2021 GOP nominee Jack Ciattarelli is a stronger favorite on his side.

— Neither Lt. Gov. Winsome Earle-Sears (R-VA) nor former Rep. Abigail Spanberger (D, VA-7) have primary competition, so Virginia

Sort byMost recentRelevance

[Virginia Governor](https://www.cookpolitical.com/analysis/governors/virginia-governor)

# Virginia Governor Moves From Toss Up to Lean Democrat

April 30, 2025

[Jessica Taylor](https://www.cookpolitical.com/about/staff/jessica-taylor/analysis)

The Virginia governor’s race is officially set, with both Democrat Abigail Spanberger and Republican Winsome Earle-Sears avoiding a primary. This means that the commonwealth will elect its first female governor come November.

When we initially rated this contest in December, we put the race in Toss Up, given the absence of early polling and the uncertainty of the political climate before Donald Trump’s second term began. However, after talks with sources on both sides of the aisle — taking into consideration the political environment, Democratic enthusiasm and

search_results.title: Virginia and New Jersey ‘lean Democratic’ in early gubernatorial ratings
The sprint to Election Day begins in the Virginia and New Jersey governor's races
search_results.text:
IE 11 is not supported. For an optimal experience visit our site on another browser.

Skip to Content

Rep. Mikie Sherrill, D-N.J., and former state Assemblyman Jack Ciattarelli, a Republican, are entering the final stretch of the New Jersey governor's race.AP

Sept. 1, 2025, 5:00 AM EDT

By [Adam Edelman](https://www.nbcnews.com/author/adam-edelman-ncpn777046) and [Bridget Bowman](https://www.nbcnews.com/author/bridget-bowman-ncpn1286094)

The year’s lone pair of gubernatorial elections are only two months away, providing one of the biggest tests for both parties since the 2024 presidential contest.

In New Jersey, Democrat Mikie Sherrill and Republican Jack Ciattarelli are locked in a competitive race that has been defined by affordability issues and the popularity of President Donald Trump and Democratic Gov. Phil Murphy.

metadata.title: Which of the 2025 Virginia and New Jersey gubernatorial elections will the Democrats win?
metadata.description:
In November 2025, the United States will be holding an [off-year election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Off-year_election), meaning that not very many races will be on the ballot. Voters in two states will be electing governors, however, and in both states the current governor is term-limited and not up for reelection.

In [Virginia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2025_Virginia_gubernatorial_election), Democrat [Abigail Spanberger](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abigail_Spanberger), a former member of Congress, is running against Republican [Winsome Earle-Sears](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winsome_Earle-Sears), the current lieutenant governor of Virginia. In recent decades, Virginia has [almost always](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Governor_of_Virginia) elected a governor from the opposite party to the sitting U.S. President, which bodes well for Spanberger, and indeed Spanberger seems to be [up in the polls](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2025_Virginia_gubernatorial_election#Polling_3). 

In [New Jersey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2025_New_Jersey_gubernatorial_election), Democrat [Mikie Sherrill](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mikie_Sherrill), a current member of Congress, is running against Republican [Jack Ciattarelli](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jack_Ciattarelli), a former member of the New Jersey General Assembly. Ciattarelli also ran for governor in 2021 and received 48.00% of the vote, losing a close election to current Democratic Governor Phil Murphy. Although thought of as a reliably blue state, New Jersey had a [Republican governor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chris_Christie) as recently as 2018. Still, the Democratic candidate seems to be [up in the polls](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2025_New_Jersey_gubernatorial_election#Polling_3) there too.

`{"format":"metac_reveal_and_close_in_period","info":{"post_id":40047,"question_id":39586}}`
metadata.resolution_criteria: This question will resolve according to which of the 2025 Virginia and New Jersey gubernatorial elections the Democrats won.
metadata.fine_print: This question is about the party of the winners; the identity of the individual candidates is immaterial.
